headline: Statshot: Carl Bialik, 'The Numbers Guy'

summary: Corrections & Amplifications for the edition of May 11-12, 2013

summary: Prospect Park South, a landmarked Brooklyn neighborhood of detached houses spread out along gracious tree-lined streets, is drawing more young families priced out of surrounding areas.

summary: Whenever Ryan Nassib dropped back to pass on the opening day of Giants rookie minicamp, he rarely had to look far for one of his old college teammates.

summary: Also in this column about current or about-to-open exhibitions: a show by the Cuban artist duo Los Carpinteros.

summary: The Millau Viaduct is more than an expedient path between points A and B.

summary: This week's column includes desuetude, plyometric, blandiloquence and magiciadas.

headline: U.K. Bank Chief Quits Amid Bailout Fears

summary: Lettie Teague visits the Yale Law School wine team, who took to wines so naturally that they're on their way to a competition in Bordeaux next month.

headline: ArcelorMittal Reports Loss
summary: Despite major cost-cutting moves, ArcelorMittal, the world's biggest steelmaker, swung to a first-quarter loss of $345 million and warned of ongoing excess supply unless major steel-producing countries cut back.

headline: Five Best: William Friedkin
summary: The Academy Award-winner recommends books on film directors.

headline: From Grief to Growth at Jackson Family Wines
summary: The wine company behind the popular Kendall-Jackson label and others lost its charismatic founder, Jess Jackson, a couple of years ago. But Lettie Teague finds that his widow, Barbara Banke, is continuing an active expansion.

section: New York House of the Day
headline: Falling in Love With Hamilton Heights
summary: The owners of this Hamilton Heights townhouse planned to live here after a gut renovation but discovered their dream home was on the market. Now the space with brand new interior is on the market for slightly under $2.7 million.

headline: U.S. Expects Record Corn Crop
summary: U.S. corn futures fell after the government forecast a record crop and higher-than-expected stockpiles. The U.S. also sees higher-than-expected stocks of soybeans and wheat, driving down futures for those products as well.

headline: Photos of the Day: May 10
summary: In today's pictures, stars streak through the sky above a volcano in Ecuador, protesters clash with female worshipers at the Western Wall in Jerusalem, men take a walk in high heels in Australia, and more.

headline: One World Trade Climbs to 1,776 Feet
summary: Workers raised the silver beacon to the top of One World Trade Center Friday, reaching a peak 1,776 feet atop the tower's 408-foot mast.

headline: How Lawyers Often Hit the Ground
summary: Richard A. Epstein's all-is-well critique of "The Lawyer Bubble" by Steven J. Harper () sounds a bit like what a medical school dean might have said shortly before the Flexner Report, backed by the Carnegie Foundation, came out in 1910.

headline: Teeth Whitening and Using Common Sense
summary: It appears that the Michigan Dental Association has discovered a previously unnoticed right of eminent domain over everyone else's mouth (Letters, May 4). Unfortunately this is in keeping with the general tendency of modern bureaucrats to claim primacy over everything within a light year of their actual mandate.

headline: Where Does the Oregon Trial Lead?
summary: Regarding your editorial(May 3): What the study didn't track is how all medical expenses for the non-Medicaid control group were paid.

headline: On the Texas and California Approach to Hydrocarbons
summary: Your editorial "A Tale of Two Oil States" (May 6) drives home issues that our organization, SOS California, has focused on in an attempt to promote public discussion and awareness of the policy decisions that have limited production of our oil and gas resources.

headline: New York Photos of the Week, May 3 - 10
summary: In this week's photos from around New York, punk fashion is on display at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Kristen Wiig returns to "Saturday Night Live" and cat entrepreneurs showcase their latest product.

headline: Motherhood With and Without Freezing One's Eggs
summary: I got to this arresting statement from Sarah Elizabeth Richards's "Why I Froze My Eggs (And You Should, Too)" (Review, May 4): "The idea is tantalizing: Once you land the job and man you want, you can have your frozen eggs shipped to your fertility clinic, hand him a semen collection cup and be on your way to parenthood."

headline: 2013 Fiat 500e
summary: Fiat and Chrysler Group Chairman Sergio Marchionne revealed that the compnay loses $10,000 apiece on its California-only electric version of the 500 subcompact, but Dan Neil says the car is worthwhile in many ways.

summary: Gold sank to a two-week low on worries about global demand for the metal and the U.S. dollar's surge.

headline: A Nomad at the End of the Road

headline: Natural Gas Sheds 1.8%
summary: Natural-gas futures fell 1.8% to a five-week low as the market has slipped into the demand lull between the peak winter and summer seasons.

headline: Fannie Chief: Payout Must Not Slow Revamp
summary: Fannie Mae said it would make a $59.4 billion payment to the U.S. Treasury after reporting a $58.7 billion first-quarter profit thanks to a big tax benefit the bailed-out mortgage-finance company booked.

headline: Indonesia to Extend Forest-Clearing Ban
summary: Indonesia's president has agreed to extend a ban keeping loggers and palm-oil makers from exploiting an area of forests and peat bogs the size of Texas, part of a key effort to contain greenhouse gases.

headline: Bring the Garden Inside With a Trellis Room
summary: Geometry intersects with romance in any space covered with latticework.

headline: Myanmar Braces for Islamists Rallying

summary: The IRS is studying a practice that can allow private-equity partners to qualify for lower tax rates.

headline: Nymex Crude Falls as Dollar, Weak Fuel Demand Weigh
summary: Crude-oil futures fell on a stronger U.S. dollar and new indications of sluggish global fuel demand.

headline: Reliance Communications Beats Profit Forecast
summary: Reliance Communications posted an 8% drop in its fourth-quarter net profit due to higher interest cost, but a steep increase in the telecommunications operator's non-operating income helped it beat market expectations.

headline: African Republic Faces Diamond Ban
summary: The body responsible for curbing trade in conflict-tainted diamonds has recommended an embargo on exports from the Central African Republic following a rebel coup in March.
